titleStmt.title: Englands friend raised from the grave. Giving seasonable advice to the Lord Generall, Lievtenant-Generall, and the Councell of Warre. Being the true copies of three letters, / written by Mr. John Saltmarsh, a little before his death.
titleStmt.author: Saltmarsh, John, d. 1647.
Saltmarsh, Mary.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Giles Calvert, at the black Spread-Eagle at the west end of Pauls,

notesStmt.note: Editor's note "To the reader" signed: Mary Saltmarsh.
The words "Lord .. Warre." are bracketed together on title page.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the black Spread-Eagle at the west end of Pauls
